sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: Audit and accountability poli</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as described in the control statements and implementation standard(s).  Systems defined as CSPs:  Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as </assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline>High; Moderate; Low</baseline> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>The information system: a. Provides audit record generation capability for the following auditable events defined in AU-2a: - All successful and unsuccessful authorization attempts; - All changes to logical access control authorities (e.g., rights, permissions); - All system changes with the potential to compromise the integrity of audit policy configurations, security policy configurations and audit record generation services; - The audit trail, which must capture the enabling or disabling of audit report generation services; and - The audit trail must capture command line changes, batch file changes and queries made to the system (e.g., operating system, application, and database). b. Allows defined personnel or roles (defined in the applicable system security plan) to select which auditable events are to be audited by specific components of the information system; and c. Generates audit records for the list of events defined in AU-2 with the content defined in AU-3.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Audit and Accountability">6887b9fcdb211010280df36f29961951</control_family> <control_name>Audit Generation</control_name> <control_number>AU-12</control_number> <control_type>Mandatory</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>AU-12</group_id> <group_list/> <high>true</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards>Systems defined as CSPs:  High, Moderate & Low:  CSP.1 - For CSPs, the information system provides audit record generation capability for the list of auditable events defined in AU-2 at all inform</implementation_standards> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>true</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>true</moderate> <number>ARSC0010888</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:22</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>3</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline; OMB Circular A-130: 7.g. and 8.b(2)(c)(iii); 45 C.F.R. ยง164.308(a)(1)(ii)(D); 45 C.F.R. ยง164.308(a)(5)(ii)(C); 45 C.F.R. ยง164.312(b)</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>AC-3, AU-2, AU-3, AU-6, AU-7</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Audit records can be generated from many different information system components. The list of audited events is the set of events for which audits are to be generated. These events are typically a subset of all events for which the information system can generate audit records.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  This control defines the technical aspects of how the privacy auditing requirements identified in controls AU-2 and AU-3 will be selected, generated and reviewed for compliance.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:22</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>6487b9fcdb211010280df36f29961994</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:22</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
